channel.title: Need some help with a crash. (with pictures)
channel.description:
Im using darkquest. Whenever a normal player logs off from ingame, it causes the whole server to shut down. The LS then displays this message:
[URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/90/screenshot20121020at125.png/][IMG]http://imageshack.us/a/img90/5840/screenshot20121020at125.png[/img][/URL]
Uploaded with [URL=http://imageshack.us]ImageShack.us[/URL]
This only happens with normal players. Moderators and Admins are not affected by this.
Heres my database setup for rscd_players_cache:
[URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/94/screenshot20121020at124.png/][IMG]http://imageshack.us/a/img94/812/screenshot20121020at124.th.png[/img][/URL]
[URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/853/screenshot20121020at124q.png/][IMG]http://imageshack.us/a/img853/158/screenshot20121020at124q.th.png[/img][/URL]
Any help is appreciated thanks!
Also, on another note:
My website decodes users' passwords with MD5, however my server reads it as SHA-1. How do I make the website translate into sha-1 instead of md5?

item.title: Need some help with a crash. (with pictures)
item.dc:creator: @Snemo Snemo
item.description:
@Snemo wrote:

[quote=“Ecko, post:5, topic:464670”]The user in the error has over 11 characters, which is more than what is displayed when using the int(11) data type. Change 11 to a reasonable number like 30. Lots of people use varchar(255) to avoid these problems.

As for you hashing question, do you mean encode? Because there is no way to ‘decode’ or ‘decrypt’ md5(). If you want it to be stored in the database a sha-1, change the part in your registration script that uses md5() on the password to sha1().[/quote]

thanks

Read full topic
item.source: Need some help with a crash. (with pictures)

item.title: Need some help with a crash. (with pictures)
item.dc:creator: @Ecko Ecko
item.description:
@Ecko wrote:

The user in the error has over 11 characters, which is more than what is displayed when using the int(11) data type. Change 11 to a reasonable number like 30. Lots of people use varchar(255) to avoid these problems.

As for you hashing question, do you mean encode? Because there is no way to ‘decode’ or ‘decrypt’ md5(). If you want it to be stored in the database a sha-1, change the part in your registration script that uses md5() on the password to sha1().

Read full topic
item.source: Need some help with a crash. (with pictures)

item.title: Need some help with a crash. (with pictures)
item.dc:creator: @Snemo Snemo
item.description:
@Snemo wrote:

KO9:

Is the row type varchar(255) ?

xEnt:

tbh, darkquest needs a lot of work to be even worth using, i found. i guess nobody who was part of that project decided to actually test it properly. it’s a good server but theres just a lot of little things here and there that need fixing. at least from the revision that prsc took.

@KO9 - look at my picture

@xEnt - Would you care to share how you fixed this error? Also, what other major errors are there besides this? I am unaware of them

Read full topic
